## Positioner.hasChanged() method

Determines whether anything has changed and whether to continue with a recalculation. By default this is only true when the document has changed.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
hasChanged(params: CompareStateParams<SchemaFromExtensions<GExtension>>): boolean;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  params | <code>CompareStateParams&lt;SchemaFromExtensions&lt;GExtension&gt;&gt;</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`boolean`

## Remarks

Sometimes it is useful to recalculate the positioner on every state update. In this case you can set this method to always return true.

\`\`\`<!-- -->ts const positioner: Positioner = { hasChanged: () =<!-- -->&gt; true

}<!-- -->;
